docs.title: Why Sitemarker?
docs.text:
storage Overwhelmed by Bookmarks?

Browser bookmarks can quickly become a disorganized mess, making it hard to find what you need when you need it. Sitemarker helps you take control.

cloud_off Privacy Concerns?

Many online bookmark services require you to trust them with your data. Sitemarker is a local, private solution, giving you full control.

search_off Hard to Search & Categorize?

Generic bookmarking tools often lack robust tagging and search capabilities. Sitemarker provides powerful features for easy retrieval.

docs.title: Key Features
docs.text:
bookmark_add Intuitive Management

Easily add, edit, and delete your site bookmarks with a clean and user-friendly interface.

sync_alt Import & Export

Seamlessly import existing browser bookmarks or export your Sitemarker collection for backup or migration.

style Customizable Themes

Personalize your Sitemarker experience with a variety of built-in themes to suit your style.

security Privacy-Focused

Your data stays local and private, giving you full control without relying on cloud services.

search Powerful Search

Quickly find any bookmark with advanced search and filtering options, including tags and descriptions.

restore Restore & Clear

Accidentally deleted something? Sitemarker offers options to clear, permanently delete, or restore records.

docs.title: Why Choose Sitemarker?
docs.text:
desktop_windows Native Desktop App

Enjoy a fast, responsive, and integrated experience on your desktop, designed for efficiency.

code Open Source & Free

Sitemarker is free and open-source software, built with transparency and community contributions in mind.

phone_android Android App Available

Manage your bookmarks on the go with a dedicated Android application, keeping your sites handy.

lock_open No Vendor Lock-in

Your data remains yours. Sitemarker's open approach ensures you're never tied to a single platform or service.

swap_horiz Your Data, Your .omio Files

Full control over your data with easy export and import of records using the universal .omio file format.

support Community Supported

Benefit from an active community and dedicated developers who are continually improving the application.

download Get Sitemarker Now info Explore Features

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text:
Sitemarker is available for Linux, Windows and Android. If the user chooses to, Sitemarker can be built to work on Mac, iOS and web, however, no official support will be given from the developer on these unofficial channels.

  • To download Sitemarker, go to the latest release page here: Github Releases
  • Then, download the release suited for your platform.

docs.title: Windows
docs.text:
There are two ways to use Sitemarker on Windows:

  • Installing
  • Without Installing

docs.title: Installing
docs.text: To install Sitemarker on Windows, download the installer version of the release. This file is usually of the format sitemarker-<VERSION>-windows-installer.exe. The installation process is straight forward - run the installer and follow the steps. Installing will create shortcuts in places you chose during the process.

docs.title: Without Installing
docs.text: To use Sitemarker on Windows without installing, download the archive version of the release. This file is usually of the format sitemarker-<VERSION>-windows.zip. To use this varient, unzip it to your preferred location and launch it by double-clicking the executable.

docs.title: Android
docs.text: If you know your Android architecture, download the apk corresponding to your device architecture as they are smaller in size. If you do not, download the file of the format sitemarker-<VERSION>-android.apk as it works for all architectures supported by Flutter apps. Currently, armeabi-v7a and arm64-v8a abis are available for download. To install it, sideload the APK. Alternatively, you can also use the APK from Izzydroid for installation. If you're using the Izzydroid repo, prefer using an F-Droid client, add the repo and install from there!

docs.title: Linux
docs.text:
Sitemarker offers the following usage methods for Linux:

  • tarball
  • snapstore
  • flatpak (through flathub)

docs.title: tarballs As Installation Source
docs.text: Get the tarball from releases. It is compressed as a .tar.xz file. Uncompress it to your preferred location. Launch sitemarker binary.

docs.title: Snapstore
docs.text:
For platforms with snap installed - Ubuntu and most Ubuntu derivatives comes with snap by default - can install sitemarker from snap store. You can either browse to the sitemarker page on your snap store client or install through command-line:

sudo snap install sitemarker

You can also visit the snapstore page here: Snapstore Listing

docs.title: Flatpak (Through Flathub)
docs.text:
Sitemarker is available as flatpak from flathub. You can use a flathub client or terminal to install it provided flatpak is installed.

flatpak install io.github.aerocyber.sitemarker

You can also visit the flathub page here: Flathub Listing

docs.title: Uninstallation Guide
docs.text:
It is sad to see a user go but we acknowledge your choice. Uninstalling Sitemarker depends on:

  • where you installed it - Android/Linux/Windows
  • how you installed it

docs.title: Installed
docs.text: To uninstall from Windows, look for an entry in Settings > Apps and uninstall from there. A copy of the uninstaller will also be present in the installation folder as unins000.exe

docs.title: Not Installed
docs.text: If you have not installed Sitemarker on Windows, that is you downloaded the zip file and extracted it, simply delete the extracted folder.

docs.title: Android
docs.text:
To uninstall from Android, long press the launcher icon, tap App Info and then tap Uninstall. This process generally depends on the version of Android, your OEM and the launcher you use.

Alternatively, use the app store management client you used.

docs.title: Snap store
docs.text:
Remove via the snap store client or on terminal run:

sudo snap remove sitemarker

docs.title: Flatpak
docs.text:
Remove via flatpak client or on terminal run:

flatpak uninstall io.github.aerocyber.sitemarker

docs.title: tarball
docs.text: Remove the extracted directory

docs.title: Update To The Latest Version
docs.text:
Checking for updates is as simple as pressing a button!

  • To check for newer version on desktop, first navigate to Settings tab:

Sitemarker Settings Page

  • Now, click the refresh button next to the Version at the bottom:

Click the refresh button to check for updates

docs.title: Auto Updates
docs.text: If you installed from any app stores (See installation guide), updates can be installed through them. On an application level, auto update notifications are NOT available as of version 3.1.1. It may be made available in a future version.

docs.title: View All Records
docs.text:
All records can be viewed on app launch. It is the application home page.

View All Records

docs.title: Add A New Record
docs.text:
To add a new record, click the icon on the app bar followed by providing the necessary details in the page that follows. Then click the button on appbar.

Android Users

Android users can share a link to Sitemarker application to autofill the URL. If you wait for a few seconds, Sitemarker will try to automatically get the website's title and fill in the Name field for you!

Add A New Record

Result

docs.title: Edit An Existing Record
docs.text:
To edit an existing record, click the icon under the record you wish to edit. Then, perform all the required edits in the page that opens. Save the record by clicking button on appbar.

Edit a record

Result

docs.title: Delete An Existing Record
docs.text:
To soft delete a record, click the icon under the desired record. A toast indicating deletion will show up and the record will be soft deleted. All soft deleted records can be restored at once. To view the deleted records, click or tap the icon on the app bar.

Records with name or URL after soft deleted records

Records with name or URL after soft deleted records WILL result in error. This is not true for those records deleted from trash.

To delete a record from trash as well (delete permanently), visit the deleted record on the recycle bin, tap/click the icon beneath the record to be permanently deleted. To delete all records in trash permanently, visit Settings and tap/click the Permanently delete all records button. There is also a button to restore all soft-deleted records as well.

Permanent Deletion

Deletion through Permanently delete all records button AND through the recycle bin ARE permanent. Records deleted in such a way cannot be restored.

docs.title: Importing a record
docs.text:
To import a .omio file (Sitemarker export file format), visit the Import/View page by clicking/tapping on app bar and clicking/tapping Import from Omio File button. Import will be done and duplicate records listed.

Duplicate records

Duplicate records will not be imported.

docs.title: Viewing content of .omio file
docs.text: To view a .omio file (Sitemarker export file format), visit the Import/View page by clicking/tapping on app bar and clicking/tapping View Omio File button.

docs.title: Export all records
docs.text: To export all records, go to Settings, tap/click Export records as omio file. On Android, the files will be exported to Downloads directory. On desktop platforms, a file location selection dialog will pop up which decides where the file is exported to.
